metadata.title: CVE-2018-1999010 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg before commit cced03dd667a5df6df8fd40d8de0bff477ee02e8 containsmultiple out of array access vulnerabilities in the mms protocol that canresult in attackers accessing out of bound data. This attack appear to beexploitable via network connectivity. This vulnerability appears to havebeen fixed in cced03dd667a5df6df8fd40d8de0bff477ee02e8 and later.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1999010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
gst-libav1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
